headline: Super Micro Computer Weighs Adding to U.S. Manufacturing Footprint. The Stock Shrugs.
summary: The embattled server maker  Super Micro Computer  hinted it was planning to expand its domestic manufacturing operation as President Donald Trump pushes to return production to the U.S.  In an interview with The Wall Street Journal published Tuesday evening, CEO Charles Liang said the company would consider expanding production in states such as Mississippi and Texas as costs in Silicon Valley climb.  The server maker already has a presence in the U.S., with headquarters in San Jose, Calif. and a manufacturing facility nearby.

headline: Supermicro Eyes Texas, Mississippi For AI Server Growth As Microsoft, Amazon Increase Spending
summary: Super Micro Computer (NASDAQ:SMCI) plans to expand its server production capacity in U.S. states such as Mississippi and Texas. Big Tech giants Microsoft Corp (NASDAQ:MSFT) and Amazon.com Inc (NASDAQ:AMZN) spend big bucks to build data centers to train and deploy artificial intelligence models globally. The company said it also got a boost from President Trump’s push for localization. Also Read: Super Micro Impacted By AI Server Delays And Nvidia Supply Limits, Analysts Lower Forecast The AI ser

headline: Is Super Micro Computer a Better Stock Pick Than Nvidia?
summary: Super Micro Computer recently signed a $20 billion deal.  Nvidia (NASDAQ: NVDA) has been a very successful stock pick over the past few years, but some are worried that it may be heading for some bumpy times.  It makes data center components that house and cool computing devices within a data center.
